column2: Question: I am in the clergy, which is supposed to be a qualifying position for student loan forgiveness. This is despite having made payments automatically without fail for over 15 years. Have a question about getting out of student loan or other debt?
column4: I’m in the clergy and have made student loan payments ‘automatically, without fail’ for 15 years — yet I somehow still owe money. Now I want to retire. What should I do?

column2: Splunk shares rose 10% after a WSJ report that Cisco had made a $20 billion plus offer; talks not active
column4: Splunk Stock Surges on Report of $20 Billion Cisco Buyout Offer

column2: Futures rose with Russia/Ukraine tensions in focus after the stock market rally sold off Friday. Tesla China sales were strong.
column4: Dow Jones Futures Erase Losses On Russia Comments; Market Rally At Key Level

column2: George Soros’ family investment office, Soros Fund Management, revealed a new stake in electric truck startup Rivian Automotive When a notable investor buys into a company it can boost a stock. This filing is, essentially, a confirmation that Soros bought in on the deal.
column4: George Soros Buys a Big Rivian Stake
